intro: Polianthes zapopanensis, commonly known as the Zapopan lily, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its foliage consists of strap-like, evergreen leaves that are often used in traditional Mexican horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
